alert.note: Alert for Boone; Clay; Jackson; Kanawha; Lincoln; Logan; Mingo; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Raleigh; Putnam (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 30 at 9:44AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Gusty showers will impact portions of southeastern Calhoun, southeastern Putnam, Kanawha, central Lincoln, Roane, southeastern Jackson, northwestern Nicholas, northwestern Mingo, southwestern Gilmer, central Braxton, northwestern Raleigh, Logan, Clay, northwestern Fayette and Boone Counties through 1045 AM EST... At 941 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers along a line extending from near Kenna to near Oppy. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Nitro, Madison, Logan, Sutton, Clay, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Sissonville, Montgomery, Chesapeake, Marmet, Belle, Chapmanville, Clendenin, Cedar Grove, Poca and East Bank. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 76. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 128. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 43 and 57. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 59 and 95. Route 119 between mile markers 1 and 80. Route 19 near mile marker 68. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Clay; Jackson; Kanawha; Lincoln; Logan; Mingo; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Raleigh; Putnam
